alert.note: Alert for Clay; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Southeast Nicholas (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Nicholas, east central Kanawha, southwestern Clay and northwestern Fayette Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 627 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over Coal Fork, or 7 miles southeast of Charleston, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Summersville, Montgomery, Chesapeake, Marmet, Ansted, Belle, Cedar Grove, East Bank, Glasgow, Smithers, Gauley Bridge, Pratt, Coal Fork, Powellton, Handley, Muddlety, Swiss, Indore and Drennan. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 99. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 82 and 95. Route 19 between mile markers 29 and 51. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
